author: Cáit Caden
title: Hospitality sector records another slight fall in staff numbers
text: The drop follows a 1% decline in staff numbers recorded in June as the sector continues to navigate cost pressures which has led to many pulling down shutters for the final time. “Closures have been occurring throughout the summer because footfall is stagnant at best and down in some parts of the country, while costs have risen exponentially,” said Restaurants Association of Ireland chief executive Adrian Cummins. The CSO figures were published after State-body for tourism Fáilte Ireland released a report which found the vast majority of restaurant operators saw fewer customers this summer compared to last year while most respondents also said their profitability has decreases year-on-year. Representative groups, including the RAI, have ramped up lobbying pressure to secure a reduction in the hospitality Vat rate in the upcoming budget, particularly for food-focused businesses. The Government has long argued that the cost of reducing Vat from 13.5% to 9% would be costly for the taxpayer in the long-run. The cost of implementing a 9% rate during the pandemic, down from 13.5%, reached more than €1bn alone. However, economist Jim Power estimated in a report released earlier this year that the average restaurant closure results in a loss of €1.36m to the State and a direct loss of around 22 jobs.

author: mdzol.com
title: Neuquén: salvaron a un bebé que estuvo encerrado en un auto
text:
Neuquén: salvaron a un bebé que estuvo encerrado en un auto
Fue rescatado por la Policía tras quedar cautivo en pleno centro de la capital de la provincia patagónica.
Una buena noticia se dio a conocer hoy en [Neuquén](https://www.mdzol.com/temas/neuquen-356.html), cuando un bebé de un mes fue rescatado por la [Policía](https://www.mdzol.com/temas/policia-2706.html) tras quedar encerrado en un auto en pleno centro de ciudad patagónica. El hecho ocurrió el jueves en la intersección de las calles Rivadavia y Córdoba. El padre del menor comenzó a desesperarse al caer en la cuenta de que se había olvidado las llaves del vehículo en el interior del rodado y las ventanillas estaban cerradas.
En ese momento, desde el Centro de Operaciones Policiales recibieron el alerta sobre el incidente, por lo que agentes policiales se movilizaron en bicicleta hasta el lugar y determinaron que el bebé se encontraba en la butaca infantil en la parte posterior del Renault Clio.
El segundo jede del Departamento de Coordinación General, comisario Néstor Catalán, señaló que "los padres estaban visiblemente angustiados", por lo que les ofrecieron romper uno de los cristales del rodado para salvar al niño, una idea que fue autorizada por los progenitores y los oficiales realizaron el procedimiento.
"El bebé estaba en buen estado gracias a que el tiempo que pasó encerrado fue corto y las condiciones climáticas no eran extremas.
Sin embargo, no dudamos en actuar con celeridad para garantizar su seguridad", agregó Catalán en declaraciones al diario La Mañana de Neuquén.
Tras ser rescatado, una ambulancia del Sistema Integrado de Emergencias de Neuquén (SIEN) concurrió allí y una médica analizó al bebé y corroboró que se encontraba bien.

title: Spell Wallet Daily Puzzle – October 14, 2024
text:
In the Spell Wallet mini app, users purchase upgrades and solve challenges to earn MANA, which gives holders access to crypto airdrops. The mini app has a magical theme, and also features an NFT marketplace where users can mint their own NFTs or purchase NFTs created by other players.

Every day, players can solve a puzzle to earn a 1 MANA reward. Here is the Spell Wallet daily puzzle solution for October 14, 2024:

If you enjoy Telegram games, weâ€™re sure you will love CoinGram, the official mini app from CoinCodex! By earning coins in the app, you will become eligible for monthly giveaways with real rewards. The more coins you get, the better chances you will have at winning a prize.
How to maximize your Spell Wallet rewards
Unlike many other Telegram games that are popular at the moment, Spell Wallet is not a â€œclickerâ€� game.
Although you have to tap the screen a few times to start MANA production, the vast majority of the game revolves around purchasing upgrades that increase your passive earning power. After you activate autoclaim, you should try to enable your boost every 6 hours if you want to maximize rewards.
In addition to buying upgrades, you can also earn MANA in the Spell Wallet mini app by completing quests, solving the daily puzzle, and inviting friends to the app.

Occasionally, Spell Wallet also partners with other crypto and blockchain projects to launch quests with special rewards.
You can earn substantial amounts of MANA by referring your friends to Spell Wallet. Hereâ€™s a quick breakdown of the rewards you get when you reach different referral targets:

Spell Wallet airdrop
Unlike most other games on Telegram, where users earn points to be eligible for the gameâ€™s airdrop, the goal of Spell Wallet is to connect users with new cryptocurrency projects and earn their tokens.
By participating in the Spell Wallet mini app and earning mana, users can become eligible for airdrops from a variety of projects. author: @ctvottawa
title: Ottawa weather: Skiers embracing the last warm days before cold spell | CTV News
text: [Skip to main content](#main) Despite the sunny and mild weather, impending cold on the horizon is prompting many skiers to make the most out of the remaining warm days of winter. Environment Canada says colder temperatures will come to the capital as soon as Thursday, with a high of minus 9 C predicted and a 60 per cent chance of snow. It was a busy day at Mount Pakenham Ski Resort, about 60 kilometres west of Ottawa, where skiers like Jennifer Elgar were taking in the sunshine on the slopes. "We find Pakenham does a great job with the snow conditions and you wouldn't even know that there's been mild temperatures this week," said Elgar. "We're really looking forward to more snow to come because they’ll be opening up more routes." Despite the unusually warm weather, part of Mount Pakenham has been open since early December. Even six-year-old Clare Elgar is eager for winter's arrival. "I get to go down lots of hills," said Clare. Mount Pakenham has been working tirelessly to produce artificial snow daily and combating the warm temperatures, which are expected to drop in the coming weeks. "We’re at 100 per cent manmade snow at this point. Mother Nature hasn't cooperated too much, but the conditions that we have to offer are really good,” said Andrew Burns, Mount Pakenham's director of operations. "We've been making snow and when they get here, they're going to be pleasantly surprised." Environment Canada says the coldest months of the year are fast approaching, hopefully giving the Rideau Canal Skateway a chance to avoid a repeat of last season, when it was unable to open. "The coldest months are January and February. I'm confident that you'll see some skating on the Rideau,” says David Phillips, Environment Canada's senior climatologist. “It may be a very short season, but I believe that there will be enough cold. I just can't believe that you'd be shut out two years in a row." Season pass holders at Pakenham say they are ready for whatever weather is ahead. Veteran skier Brad O’Neil visits the resort more than 70 times a season and says he’ll be out here even when it’s minus 30 C. "Yeah, absolutely. Just put layers on," says O’Neil. Even 75-year-old Allan Meadows remains undeterred by the cold. He says any skiing is good skiing. "For us old diehards, we're out on the hill in any condition and we don't really care as long as we're turning our skis," said Meadows. author: archyde
title: Where is the unique shroud in Lviv and why the "Graceful Fire" is a Moscow myth. Results of the day - Archyde
text: Today is May 4 and the 801st day of heroic resistance to Russian aggression. Highlight of the day: What is the “Holy Light” and how Russia imposes the “Graceful Fire”. Tvoemisto.tv published information about the broadcast of the descent of the “Graceful Fire”, to which our readers immediately reacted and wrote about the spread of manipulative information. So after that, Tvoemisto.tv spoke with Father Yustin Boyk and now explains why the “Graceful Fire” is a Moscow myth. “The Moscow Patriarchate has been promoting this information for years in order to show the supremacy of Orthodoxy. But it was only propaganda, which is now collapsing. And that’s why many people are in shock who believed in the myth,” – say Fr. Justin. Read also: A unique shroud, or Where in Lviv you can touch Christ. In Lviv, we have the only exact copy of the Shroud of Turin, the only one in Ukraine and one of the few in the world , consecrated on the original, which was presented to us by the Vatican in 2005. The situation at the front: According to the General Staff (as of 6:00), happened in a day 119 combat clashes, of which 34 and 27 are on the Avdiiv and Bakhmut directions. Ukrainian aviation struck at 13 areas of concentration of enemy personnel and 3 – at its control points. Units of missile forces the control post and 2 enemy artillery pieces were hit. At night, the Russian invaders once again attacked Ukraine, using 13 unmanned aerial vehicles of the “Shahed” type. Air defense forces of Ukraine 13 attack UAVs were destroyed. Read also: A monk from the Lviv region collected 1.5 million for the Lviv brigade. “I’m completely stopping the collection for the purchase of FPV drones, and I’m starting the collection for EWs of our soldiers, repair of automobile equipment, medicine.” Ta: More than $8 million was stolen on equipment for the production of projectiles. Officials of the “Artem” plant will be tried. The plant never received the equipment, but the organizer of the equipment was abroad. Theme of the day: “We are ready to share all difficulties with the team.” Recipes for Easter and successful business from Elena Vovk. Tvoemisto.tv and host Volodymyr Glaschenkov continue the video project #Military Economy Kitchen, in which company owners and managers share their unique experience and give useful advice while cooking. This time, while baking Easter pastries, he discussed with the co-owner of Enzym Group, one of the most sustainable biotechnology companies in Eastern Europe, Olena Vovk, the company’s development strategy, values and place in the world market, the launch of new projects despite the war, and the preservation of family traditions. Key events: 1. The Security Service called for limiting attendance at mass events during the Easter period. The occupiers use a large arsenal of subversive activities against Ukraine. Read also: How many churches of the Moscow Patriarchate remain in the Lviv region. We have the fewest of them in Ukraine. Ta: How will public transport run during the Easter holidays in Lviv. Buses, trams and trolleybuses will depart with slightly longer intervals; 2. “Get your attic in order.” A large part of Ukrainians still hasn’t thrown out the remnants of communism, socialism or paternalism. This is the opinion of Valery Pekar, a teacher at the Kyiv-Mohyla Business School and UKU: either each and every one of us will put order in our own attic, or this junk will define our lives for the next generation. Read also: British Foreign Minister David Cameron arrived in Lviv on a working visit. He met with the mayor and the head of the Lviv OVA. Ta: Switzerland will help establish rehabilitation centers in the Lviv region. Specialists from Switzerland also supported the organization of training for psychologists on the basis of the Ukrainian Catholic University; 3. In Lviv, an emergency section of the road was repaired. Photos before and after. From the street New asphalt was laid on Princess Olga and Pulyuy. Read also: New rest areas for public transport drivers may be set up in Lviv. In particular, at Ryashivska, 1 and E. Konovaltsia, 111. Ta: They wanted to build an 8-story office on the territory of the former Kinescope plant. They were refused. In connection with the historical area; 4. Paintings depicting Lviv volunteers will be presented in Paris and New York. Lviv residents were the first to see the exhibition. Read also: Lviv is looking for benefactors to plant bushes on Rynok Square. The price for 1 box is UAH 3,500, it will be possible to place a sign about the benefactor if desired; 5. Lviv residents are invited to the “Lviv Kites” festival. Program. There will be events of different nature and for different audiences – adults and children. Read also: Weather for Easter in Lviv. Weathermen’s forecast. On the Easter weekend, May 4-5, Lviv will be partly cloudy, without significant precipitation. The wind will be south-easterly, changing to south-westerly, 5-10 m/s. The temperature at night is 5-10 degrees Celsius, during the day 19-24 degrees Celsius. Glory to Ukraine. Have a good day! author: T13
title: "De tú a tú" con Carmen Barros: “Siendo creyente, pienso qué lata más grande morirse” | T13
text: Este sábado, después de " [Socios de la parrilla](https://www.t13.cl/buscador/Socios%20de%20la%20parrilla)", [Canal 13](https://www.13.cl/) transmitirá a modo de homenaje, un episodio inédito y póstumo del programa “De tú a tú”, debido al reciente fallecimiento de la destacada y querida actriz nacional Carmen Barros. Se trata de un capítulo grabado hace poco tiempo y que estaba considerado para ser parte de la próxima temporada del espacio de conversación conducido por [Martín Cárcamo](https://www.t13.cl/buscador/mart%C3%ADn%20carcamo). Martín conversó con Carmen, que fue parte de la historia y de las artes en Chile, con más de 70 años de trayectoria profesional, con una vida fascinante y que destacó, entre muchos otros proyectos, como la primera “Carmela” de la icónica obra musical “La pérgola de las flores”. [ Lee También > Clausuran local de donas en Providencia por intervenir casona patrimonial: Pintaron tejas y ventanas rosadas ](/noticia/nacional/clausuran-local-donas-providencia-por-intervenir-casona-patrimonial-pintaron-tejas-ventana) Lo primero que conversó con Cárcamo fue sobre la edad, “tienes 48 y yo tengo 98 años y me quedan dos para los 100. Es que mi padre murió a los 101, entonces a lo mejor heredo eso y le digo 'mira tata Dios, no me llames todavía'”. Carmen Barros comentó que su padre conoció a Adolf Hitler La emblemática actriz, a sus 98 años, rememoró la historia de su familia, sus padres, sus tres hijos, sus rutinas y sus costumbres diarias: “No me interesa mucho la comida, me encanta el pan con mantequilla… de vez en cuando una copita de vino con el almuerzo” y agregó, “estoy un poco floja porque me da lata caminar. Soy feliz, sentada y moviéndome dentro de mi casa”. La apreciada artista tocó el piano y cantó la famosa canción de la “Carmela”. Además, desclasificó que su padre conoció a Adolf Hitler en razón de su cargo diplomático. Fue en ese período donde Carmen habló con sus padres y les dijo “que era una estupidez estudiar cuando yo voy a ser cantante”. También contó que a los 15 años le confesó lo siguiente: “Lo lamento mucho, pero no quiero ir más al colegio, así que yo quiero clases en la casa de las cosas que necesito… y ellos me encontraron razón en mi pedido”. Carmen Barros reveló en "De tú a tú" que su padre falleció a los 101 años y que uno de los momentos más duros de su vida fue la muerte de su madre a los 60 años: “A mi madre la tengo aquí, conmigo todo el tiempo, pienso en mi madre todo el tiempo, creo que ella está conmigo. Soy muy creyente... soy pecadora, pero creyente”. En relación a la muerte, sentenció “odio la muerte, me parece que es la cosa más estúpida que existe. Siendo creyente, pienso qué lata más grande morirse, cuando no tenemos por qué morirnos si podemos seguir viviendo. ¿Por qué el tata Dios no viene para acá y juega con nosotros?”, y añadió “como soy muy creyente, tengo la seguridad que me voy a encontrar con todos”. También conversó con Martín sobre sus amores, su marido Jaime Amunátegui, con quien tuvo tres hijos y una inestable relación, pero terminaron siendo muy amigos. Luego, se volvió a enamorar y pensó en casarse, pero el hombre falleció en un accidente de automóvil. “Fue muy doloroso, fue terrible porque al día siguiente íbamos a salir con los niños. Murió de forma instantánea y salió desde mi casa... pero acepto todo lo que me pasó y tengo una gran tranquilidad porque sé que a todos me los voy a encontrar. Y sí, amaba mucho a esa persona”, manifestó Carmen Barros. Cambiando de tema, desclasificó que no le gustaban los hogares ni asilos para personas mayores, “yo tengo casa, yo quiero morir en mi departamento. Eso es lo que yo pediría. Ahora, si no va a ser así, no lo sé, pero prefiero no pensarlo, porque me carga la muerte”. En relación a su carrera artística, su personaje ícono fue “Carmela” de “La pérgola de las flores” en el año 1960, que cambió su vida para siempre. A ella, al principio, no le gustó porque encontraba que no sabía nada de folclore. Además, desclasificó que Isidora Aguirre, la autora de la obra, “estaba empecinada que yo no fuera la ‘Carmela’, porque encontraba que yo era demasiado refinada y tenía un poco de razón, porque yo me sentía falsa haciéndola”. Junto a su larga carrera en el teatro, recordaron en "De tú a tú" su participación en inolvidables teleseries de Canal 13, como “Los títeres, “La intrusa” y “Acércate más”, además de su participación en diversos programas, como “Martes 13” y “Noche de gigantes”. Asimismo, rememoraron su rol protagónico en la versión chilena de la serie “Los años dorados”, en el ex UCV-TV.
